title: Dominican Biblical Institute
text:
The Dominican Biblical Institute (DBI) was a biblical research center, initiated and financed by the Irish Dominican friars in <a href="Limerick">Limerick</a>, <a href="Republic%20of%20Ireland">Ireland</a>. Founded in 2000, it closed in September 2015.
History.
The Dominican Province of Ireland founded the in 2000 to engage in advanced <a href="Bible">biblical</a> research, training and teaching. The Institute was formally established in 2007. At this time they took on several PhD candidates, such as John B. Shelton, Mary T Brien, and Thomas P. Nelligan. Nelligan graduated in 2012, and Brien in 2013.
The ran a Diploma in Biblical and Theological Studies is a 3-year, level 6 course, accredited by the <a href="St.%20Patrick%27s%20College%2C%20Maynooth">St. Patrick's College, Maynooth</a>. The 30th May 2012 saw successful students being awarded diplomas by Maynooth at a Graduation Ceremony. A further group of students were awarded the diploma in autumn 2014, and the final group were awarded the diploma in 2015. The Institute closed due to financial pressures in 2015, this coincided with the Dominicans leaving Limerick.
The library was distributed to other Dominican institutions in Ireland.
The purpose-built facility is currently for sale.
Directors of the DBI.
Fr. Dermot Brennan OP who was prior in Limerick conceived the idea of the DBI and stayed as its head until it was officially launched.
